skill.name: pubchem-database
skill.description: Query PubChem via PUG-REST API/PubChemPy (110M+ compounds). Search by name/CID/SMILES, retrieve properties, similarity/substructure searches, bioactivity, for cheminformatics.
skill.summary: Query PubChem via PUG-REST API/PubChemPy (110M+ compounds). Search by name/CID/SMILES, retrieve prop...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or exfiltration behavior detected. Network calls target PubChem endpoints only and align with the skill purpose.

content.value_statement: Find chemical compounds and bioactivity data without memorizing PubChem endpoints. This skill queries PubChem and summarizes properties, similarity hits, and assay activity.
actual_capabilities: Search compounds by name, CID, or SMILES using PubChemPy
Retrieve selected molecular properties for a compound
Run similarity and substructure searches by SMILES
Download compound structures in SDF, JSON, or PNG
Summarize bioactivity outcomes from PubChem assays
limitations: Requires internet access to PubChem services
Subject to PubChem rate limits and request timeouts
Depends on PubChemPy and requests being installed
Some properties or assays may be missing for a compound

use_cases.title: Compare lead candidates
use_cases.description: Pull properties and similarity hits to compare potential lead compounds against known drugs.

use_cases.title: Scan assay activity
use_cases.description: Summarize active and inactive assay outcomes for a target compound or assay list.

use_cases.title: Learn structure searches
use_cases.description: Practice name, SMILES, and substructure searches with clear PubChem examples.

prompt_templates.title: Find a compound
prompt_templates.prompt: Find aspirin in PubChem and list CID, formula, molecular weight, and canonical SMILES.

prompt_templates.title: Property shortlist
prompt_templates.prompt: Get MolecularWeight, XLogP, and TPSA for caffeine and ibuprofen.

prompt_templates.title: Similarity screen
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a similarity search for benzene SMILES c1ccccc1 with threshold 95 and list five CIDs.

prompt_templates.title: Bioactivity summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Summarize bioactivity outcomes for CID 2244 and report total, active, inactive, and inconclusive counts.

output_examples.input: Summarize aspirin properties and give two close analogs.
output: CID 2244, formula C9H8O4, molecular weight about 180.16
Key properties: XLogP around 1.2 and TPSA around 63.6
Similar compounds: salicylic acid (CID 338) and acetylsalicylic analogs

best_practices: Use CIDs for repeated queries to reduce ambiguity
Limit MaxRecords and add delays to respect rate limits
Check for missing properties before using them in analysis
anti_patterns: Requesting massive similarity searches without MaxRecords
Assuming every compound has all property fields
Ignoring rate limit guidance during batch runs

faq.question: Is it compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides prompts and Python helpers that work in those platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: PubChem rate limits and occasional timeouts limit large or rapid queries.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into a pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the Python scripts to call searches and property retrieval in batch jobs.

faq.question: Does it access my private data?
faq.answer: No. It only calls PubChem endpoints for public chemical data.

faq.question: What if a query fails or returns nothing?
faq.answer: Try a CID, check spelling, reduce MaxRecords, and retry with delays.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual PubChem browsing?
faq.answer: It automates search, property extraction, and assay summaries without manual web navigation.
